fields.title: SQL Injection Basics
fields.description:
Your mission is to exploit a vulnerable login form. The authentication system uses a SQL database, but it doesn't properly sanitize user inputs. Can you bypass the login without knowing the password?

Access the vulnerable application at the provided URL.
hints: Try using SQL comments to bypass authentication logic.
Common SQL injection payloads use single quotes and OR conditions.
The classic payload is: ' OR '1'='1

fields.title: Caesar's Secret
hints: This is a Caesar cipher with a shift value.
Try different shift values from 1 to 25.
The shift value is 5.

fields.title: Hidden in Plain Sight
fields.description:
We received this image file. At first glance, it looks normal, but our intelligence suggests there's hidden information inside. Can you extract the secret message?

Download: stego_challenge.png
hints: Check the image metadata first.
Try using steghide or similar tools.
The password is 'hacman'.

fields.title: Memory Forensics
hints: Use Volatility framework for memory analysis.
Start with the 'pslist' plugin to see running processes.
Look for unusual process names or suspicious parent-child relationships.

fields.title: Buffer Overflow 101
fields.description:
We have a vulnerable binary that has a buffer overflow vulnerability. The binary prompts for input and processes it unsafely. Can you exploit this to read the flag from the server?

Connect to: nc ctf.example.com 9001
Download binary: vuln_binary
hints: The binary has NX disabled, so you can execute shellcode on the stack.
Find the offset to overwrite the return address.
Use pattern_create and pattern_offset from GDB-PEDA.

fields.title: XSS Playground
fields.description:
This web application has a comment system. Unfortunately, it doesn't properly sanitize user input. Can you inject JavaScript to steal the admin's cookie?

The admin bot will visit your comment every 30 seconds.

URL: http://ctf-challenges.local/xss-playground
hints: Try basic XSS payloads like <script>alert(1)</script>
The application filters some tags but not all.
Use event handlers like onerror or onload in img tags.

fields.title: RSA Beginner
fields.description:
We intercepted an RSA-encrypted message. The public key parameters are:

N = 323
e = 5
Encrypted message: 70

Can you decrypt it and find the flag?
hints: N is the product of two primes. Try factoring it.
Once you have p and q, calculate phi(N) = (p-1)(q-1).
Find d, the modular inverse of e mod phi(N).

fields.title: Network Packet Analysis
fields.description:
We captured network traffic from a suspicious connection. Analyze the PCAP file and find the exfiltrated data.

Download: traffic_capture.pcap

The flag is in the exfiltrated data.
hints: Use Wireshark to analyze the PCAP file.
Look for HTTP POST requests or FTP transfers.
Follow TCP streams to reconstruct the data.
